# isConcurrent

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value indicating whether the operation executes its task asynchronously.

## Declaration

```swift
var isConcurrent: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

Use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Operation/isAsynchronous] property instead.

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for operations that run asynchronously with respect to the current thread or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for operations that run synchronously on the current thread. The default value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

In macOS 10.6 and later, operation queues ignore the value in this property and always start operations on a separate thread.

## Getting the Operation Status

- **isCancelled**: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation has been cancelled
- **isExecuting**: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation is currently executing.
- **isFinished**: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation has finished executing its task.
- **isAsynchronous**: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation executes its task asynchronously.
- **isReady**: A Boolean value indicating whether the operation can be performed now.
- **name**: The name of the operation.
